intro: Veronica borysthenica, commonly known as the steppe speedwell, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Veronica borysthenica is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
